page.title: 02UPHAM PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Upham Church has changed a lot over the years. It used to have thatch on the roof but now it has slate. In 1598 the church was made up of a squat tower, nave, chancel and south aisle. There were galleries and some wooden panelling. The bell tower was built in the 18th century. Oliver Cromwell is reputed to have stabled his horses in the church! These days sheep graze amongst the graves, some of which date from 1800. From 1304 to 1814 and 1954 to 1978 the two parishes of Durley and Upham were served by one Rector. However, in 1978, due to the enforced early retirement through sickness of the Reverend Dick Catley, the link was finally broken and Upham became joined to the parish of Bishops Waltham. In 1981 the church was visited by Lady Diana and Prince Charles.
